Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements about user-defined dialog boxes are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: A user-defined dialog box can be defined as modal and modeless.
A user-defined dialog box can be created using the <font face="courier new">FormBorderStyle</font> property of a form.
A user-defined dialog box can be created by setting the <font face="courier new">MaximizeBox</font> and <font face="courier new">MinimizeBox</font> properties to <font face="courier new">True</font>.
A user-defined dialog box can have the Cancel button using the <font face="courier new">CancelButtons</font> property.
A user-defined dialog box can have an OK button using the <font face="courier new">AcceptButtons</font> property.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that’s correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that’s incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(True), (B)-(True), (C)-(False), (D)-(False), and (E)-(False).
